result.execSummary:
The defendant Orion H. Funmaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Report to jail on or before 10/14/2022, no later than 4:00 pm.

Per Statute 343.301(g) your operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles will require that vehicles owned and/or driven by you be equipped with an ignition interlock device.  Must install a mandatory Ignition Interlock Device when defendant obtains an occupational license or regular license.  There is a $50 ignition interlock surcharge imposed.
Must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and a driver safety plan.  You must also comply with any recommendations.

Fine and costs are due as follows: $100.00 is due on or before 11/01/2022 and then $100.00 is due by the first of the month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid  or a civil judgement entered for collection purposes. $15.00 payment plan fee added. 

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.

records.addlTxt:
1:26 PM Defendant Orion H. Funmaker in court.  Attorney Sasa G Johnen in court for Orion H. Funmaker.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1, Counts 2, 3 and 22CT23 DRI. 

Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood. Priors stipulated to. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of OWI (2nd) contrary to 346.63(1)(a). Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution. 

Joint recommendation: 0.195 chemical result in,  20 days jail, 14 month DL revocation, 14 month IID, fine $1555.00, $75 blood draw fee,  alcohol assessment driver safety plan. 

Court adopts joint recommendation: Sentenced to 20 days jail, 14 month DL revocation, 14 month IID, fine & costs $1555.00, $75 blood draw fee, alcohol assessment driver safety plan. Report to jail on or before no later than 4 pm on Friday Oct 14th. 1 day sentence credit. Pay at $100.00 per month, starting on 11/1, pay each month thereafter until paid in full. 

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:27 AM Defendant Orion H. Funmaker appeared by phone.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. He is still looking for representation.  AIA set for 6/6 at 9 am.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
